org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.external.samples

Class ConceptCompassCalibration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
      • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode
        • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.external.samples.ConceptCompassCalibration

  • @TeleOp(name="Concept: Compass Calibration",
        group="Concept")
 @Disabled
public class ConceptCompassCalibration
extends com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode
    This file illustrates the concept of calibrating a MR Compass It uses the common Pushbot hardware class to define the drive on the robot. The code is structured as a LinearOpMode

    This code assumes there is a compass configured with the name "compass"

    This code will put the compass into calibration mode, wait three seconds and then attempt to rotate two full turns clockwise. This will allow the compass to do a magnetic calibration.

    Once compete, the program will put the compass back into measurement mode and check to see if the calibration was successful.

    Use Android Studio to Copy this Class, and Paste it into your team's code folder with a new name. Remove or comment out the @Disabled line to add this opmode to the Driver Station OpMode list
